page.title: 04RELIGION
page.content: The Carse,Merkinch and Kessock once had three Church of Scotland congretations.Now it is one big parish of Trinity Church.Most people want the Rev.Norman MacRae for weddings, funerals and hospital visits even if they don't attend church.In 1984 he had 67 weddings and 63 funerals.His 500 members and Sunday School also come from other parts of town.In 1861 his Church began a mission here for "4 000 souls",poor labourers who spoke Gaelic.There are more skilled workers now.They have new houses and speak English.There is a lot of unemployment Members of the Scottish Free Church, the Baptist Church and the Episcopalian Church also live here. Children attend their Sunday Schools. There is a Salvation Army Goodwill Centre in Craigton Avenue.A few people have now become Mormons or Bahaists.
